law.catch_line: Law Governing Validity; Choice Of Law As To Execution Of Document Of Gift; Presumption Of Validity
law.text: [ Text of section added by 2012, 39, Sec. 3 effective February 22, 2012.] (a) A document of gift shall be valid if executed in accordance with: (1) this chapter; (2) the laws of the state or country where it was executed; or (3) the laws of the state or country where the person making the anatomical gift was domiciled, has a place of residence or was a national at the time the document of gift was executed. (b) If a document of gift is valid under this section, then this chapter shall govern the interpretation of the document of gift. (c) A person may presume that a document of gift or amendment of an anatomical gift is valid unless that person knows that it was not validly executed or was revoked.
